Administrative Manager Job at Best Nigerian Schools




        
    

        
        Best Nigerian Schools - We provide comprehensive reviews, rankings, latest updates, and insights into the Nigerian educational sector, ensuring that you have all the information you need about the Nigerian educational system. Our mission is to empower families with the tools they need to find the perfect learning environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Manager

Job Location: Nigeria

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Best Nigerian Schools is seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive Administrative Manager to oversee daily operations, streamline workflows, and support the smooth functioning of our remote team.
	The ideal candidate will ensure efficiency across all administrative processes, coordinate team activities, and maintain high operational standards that align with our mission and goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee and manage daily administrative operations to ensure seamless workflow across all departments.
	Develop, implement, and optimize administrative systems, policies, and procedures.
	Maintain accurate records, files, and databases for internal use.
	Coordinate virtual meetings, schedules, travel arrangements, and communications.
	Support HR functions, including onboarding, documentation, compliance, and general staff coordination.
	Serve as a central point of contact for internal teams, partners, and external stakeholders.
	Prepare and manage reports, correspondence, and documentation.
	Track project timelines, follow up with team members, and ensure deadlines are met.
	Monitor compliance with organizational standards and identify areas for improvement.
	Assist leadership with strategic planning, operational support, and special projects.


Requirements


	HND or Bachelor’s degree in any discipline.
	Proven experience as an Administrative Manager, Operations Manager, Office Manager, or similar role.
	Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to multitask in a remote work environment.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency with digital tools such as Google Workspace, Microsoft Office Suite, project management platforms, and remote collaboration software.
	Ability to work independently, exercise sound judgment, and maintain confidentiality.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience supporting remote teams or digital-first organizations.
	Familiarity with HR processes, performance tracking tools, and workflow optimization.
	Knowledge of basic finance/admin tasks (invoicing, budgeting, vendor coordination).
	Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset.
	Interest in education, school rankings, content operations, or the Nigerian education sector (added advantage).
	Able to resume within two weeks following a successful interview.


Salary
N273,000 / month.

title: Job Vacancies at Global Recruit Desk
content:
Global Recruit Desk is a recruitment and staffing agency that helps businesses hire skilled, reliable and vetted remote staff across Nigeria and Africa. We specialise in recruiting Virtual Assistants, Content Assistants, Customer Support staff, Editors, Bookkeepers and Admin professionals. Our goal is to connect great talent to great companies quickly, professionally and transparently.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Audit / Account Assistant

Job Location: Lagos

Role Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Audit Assistant will support the internal audit function, review financial documents, check compliance, verify entries, and assist with VictoriaHalf’s practical audit examples.
	This role requires accuracy, honesty, attention to detail, and strong analytical skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Review financial documents for correctness
	Assist with internal audit checks
	Help verify receipts, invoices, entries & files
	Identify discrepancies and report findings
	Perform basic compliance checks
	Prepare audit working papers
	Assist with simple reconciliations
	Maintain organised audit documentation
	Support VictoriaHalf’s audit training tasks
	Work with the Executive Operations Assistant to ensure audit tasks flow properly


Qualifications


	OND / HND / BSc in Accounting, Finance or related field
	Strong understanding of auditing & bookkeeping
	Strong attention to detail
	Strong accuracy in documentation
	Good use of Excel / Google Sheets
	Ability to maintain confidentiality
	Must work in-house, not remotely
	Should be able to prepare the financial statement
	Assist in bank reconciliation reviews
	Review petty cash and expense reports
	Ensure adherence to company policies and procedures


Should be able to use at least one accounting software, or be willing to learn, such as:


	QuickBooks
	Sage
	Xero
	Zoho Books
	Wave


Salary
N180,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: sarah@globalrecruitdesk.online using "Application – [Job Position]" as the subject of the email.

Note


	It is highly preferred if applicants live around CMD Road, Ikosi, Ketu, Magodo, or nearby areas in Lagos.
	Applicants must be able to speak and write English fluently.
	Please do NOT apply if you do not have good English communication skills.
	Successful candidates must be available for an immediate start.


 

2.) Executive Operations Assistant

Job Location: Lagos

Required Skills & Experience


	HND / BSc in any field (Business, Admin, Accounting, Social Sciences preferred)
	1–3 years experience in operations, administration, coordination, or EA roles
	Excellent spoken and written English
	Strong leadership, supervision and people-management ability
	Confident handling client calls, enquiries and meetings
	Very strong organisation, follow-up and deadline management skills
	Ability to assign tasks and monitor daily performance of staff
	High level of professionalism, confidentiality and integrity
	Proficiency with Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive), email and WhatsApp Business
	Must be able to manage multiple projects at the same time
	Must work physically in the office.


Other Requirements:


	Must be available full-time, in-house
	Must be professional, presentable, and trustworthy.


Salary
N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: sarah@globalrecruitdesk.online using "Application – [Job Position You Are Applying For]" as the subject of the email.

Note


	It is highly preferred if applicants live around CMD Road, Ikosi, Ketu, Magodo, or nearby areas in Lagos.
	Applicants must be able to speak and write English fluently.
	Please do NOT apply if you do not have good English communication skills.
	Successful candidates must be available for an immediate start.


 

 

3.) In-house Virtual Assistant

Job Location: Lagos
Work Type: Full-Time

Required Skills


	We want smart, organised people — Degree is not the main focus.
	Good communication skills
	Basic computer literacy
	Ability to handle admin tasks
	Good organisation and attention to detail
	Good typing speed
	Ability to learn fast
	Strong sense of discipline
	Must be able to work in the office daily.


Extra Advantage (not compulsory):


	Experience as a VA, admin officer or customer support
	Knowledge of Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets)
	Basic research skills.


Salary
N120,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV directly to: sarah@globalrecruitdesk.online using "Application – [Job Position You Are Applying For]" as the subject of the mail.

Note


	It is highly preferred if applicants live around CMD Road, Ikosi, Ketu, Magodo, or nearby areas in Lagos.
	Applicants must be able to speak and write English fluently.
	Please do NOT apply if you do not have good English communication skills.
	Successful candidates must be available for an immediate start.

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja / Remote
Employment Type: Full Time

Role Overview


	The Social Media Manager will shape, execute, and optimize TEDxMaitama&rsquo;s presence across all social platforms.
	You will craft content that elevates our speakers, amplifies our events, grows our community, and communicates our mission with clarity and creativity.
	This role is ideal for someone who loves storytelling, understands digital culture, and thrives in a fast-paced, impact-driven environment.

Content Strategy &amp; Execution:


	Develop and implement a multi-platform social media strategy aligned with TEDxMaitama&rsquo;s goals and event timelines.

	Create or coordinate the production of high-quality posts: graphics, short-form videos, clips, carousels, and thread-style content.

	Engage with audiences across Instagram, X/Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, YouTube, TikTok, and emerging platforms.
	Respond to comments, DMs, and community questions with warmth, accuracy, and professionalism.

        TEDxMaitama is an independently organised TED event operated under license from TED. It is a one-day event featuring eminent speakers from different fields that will share unique ideas about our community here in Abuja, Nigeria and beyond. We believe passionately in the power of ideas to change attitudes, lives and ultimately, the world. We believe in the power of conversations to shape minds into action.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager

Job Location: Abuja / Remote
Employment Type: Full Time

Role Overview

	The Social Media Manager will shape, execute, and optimize TEDxMaitama’s presence across all social platforms.
	You will craft content that elevates our speakers, amplifies our events, grows our community, and communicates our mission with clarity and creativity.
	This role is ideal for someone who loves storytelling, understands digital culture, and thrives in a fast-paced, impact-driven environment.


Key Responsibilities
Content Strategy & Execution:


	Develop and implement a multi-platform social media strategy aligned with TEDxMaitama’s goals and event timelines.
	Plan monthly content calendars covering announcements, speaker highlights, behind-the-scenes, thought pieces, reels/shorts, testimonials, and partnerships.
	Create or coordinate the production of high-quality posts: graphics, short-form videos, clips, carousels, and thread-style content.


Community Management:


	Engage with audiences across Instagram, X/Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, YouTube, TikTok, and emerging platforms.
	Respond to comments, DMs, and community questions with warmth, accuracy, and professionalism.
	Build conversations around key themes such as innovation, leadership, personal transformation, sustainability, and women’s empowerment.


Growth & Analytics:


	Track performance metrics weekly/monthly and optimize content for engagement, reach, and follower growth.
	Run experiments around formats, hooks, hashtags, and publishing times to maximize discoverability.

	Work with the Creative and Partnerships teams to support campaigns, speaker announcements, and sponsorship deliverables.


Qualifications


	Proven experience managing social media for an organization, brand, or creator.
	Strong writing, captioning, and storytelling skills.
	Ability to edit short-form videos (Reels, Shorts, TikTok) is a strong advantage.
	Familiarity with digital tools like Canva, CapCut, Adobe Suite, Meta Business Suite, and analytics dashboards.
	Passion for ideas, culture, innovation, and community-building.
